title: The Opening of the American Voter’s Mind
text:
In an era of political polarization, most pundits believe persuadable voters are near extinction and base mobilization is the key to victory. The annual Public Religion Research Institute/Brookings Institution American Values survey released on Monday suggests this view is wrong.

Among registered voters, 29% say that they will support Donald Trump no matter who the Democratic candidate turns out to be, and 40% say they will support the Democrat no matter what. But 29% say their vote will depend on which candidate the Democrats...
description: Nearly one-third say their presidential vote will depend on the Democratic nominee.
